<< pi constructors functions

zeros

Creates an matrix made of zeros.

Syntax

R = zeros
R = zeros(n)
R = zeros(n, m)
R = zeros(n, m, ..., z)
R = zeros(n, m, ..., z, 'like', V)
R = zeros(n, m, ..., z, classname)

Input argument

n

a variable

m

a variable

Description

zeros returns a matrix made of zeros.

Examples

zeros(3,2)


zeros(3,1,3,'single')


A = single([3 3])
B = zeros(2,4,'like', A)


tic(); single(1) * zeros(1000); toc()
tic();zeros(1000,'single'); toc()

See also

eye, ones.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
